title: Angular momentum - functional dependence on angle

content.question: In an experiment, a puck slides toward the end of a rod that is free to rotate on a horizontal surface about a pivot at its left end, as shown in the top view figure. In each trial, the puck slides with constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> but the angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> between the velocity vector and the rod is varied. The angular momentum <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> of the puck about the pivot immediately before the puck reaches the rod is calculated. Which of the following graphs could show <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> as a function of <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows a curve graphed in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled 0. The vertical axis is labeled L. The curve starts at the origin and slopes upward and to the right. The slope of the curve gradually decreases, becoming nearly level at the point with coordinates pi over 2 comma 5 units.
